column4: maxim, have them ship it back, fix it and mail it back to the colo

that's a alot of downtime to cross the country, and expensive... it'd be cheaper to pay them to roll a crash cart over and do the install... but i don't trust them. and since it's in production and can't afford downtime of shipping, it's just gonna leave the ram empty
i suppose i could basically create a 64bit libs dir, install 64bit mysql, install a 64 bit kernel, reboot and hope
but being remote makes that too risky
